2.text: Thinkest thou this to be thy right, Or sayest thou: ‘I am righteousness before God’,

3.text: That thou inquirest: ‘What advantage will it be unto Thee?’ And: ‘What profit shall I have, more than if I had sinned?’

4.text: I will give thee answer, And thy companions with thee.

5.text: Look unto the heavens, and see; And behold the skies, which are higher than thou.

6.text: If thou hast sinned, what doest thou against Him? And if thy transgressions be multiplied, what doest thou unto Him?

7.text: If thou be righteous, what givest thou Him? Or what receiveth He of thy hand?

8.text: Thy wickedness concerneth a man as thou art; And thy righteousness a son of man.

9.text: By reason of the multitude of oppressions they cry out; They cry for help by reason of the arm of the mighty.

10.text: But none saith: ‘Where is God my Maker, Who giveth songs in the night;

11.text: Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, And maketh us wiser than the fowls of heaven?’

12.text: There they cry, but none giveth answer, Because of the pride of evil men.

13.text: Surely God will not hear vanity, Neither will the Almighty regard it.

14.text: Yea, when thou sayest thou canst not see Him—The cause is before Him; therefore wait thou for Him.

15.text: And now, is it for nought that He punished in His anger? And hath He not full knowledge of arrogance?

16.text: But Job doth open his mouth in vanity; He multiplieth words without knowledge.
